" The Ikigai App presents the user with a simple and quick way to get their Ikigai."
Ikigai is a Japanese word meaning something close to \"reason to live\". Usually a figure is made up of four circles that have all the possibilities of intersections between them

By clicking the start button you will have two options to mount your ikigai. Auto-Mount: Where the app itself creates the 4 circles for you. Manually Mount: Where you can manually enter each circle by choosing the color for each one. Let\'s start?

"In order to get your Ikigai, one begins by drawing the four circles. Once drawn, you have to fill in the fields of each circle that has no intersection with the others. The filling should look like this: - What do you love? \"What does the world need?\" \"What can you get paid for?\" \"What are you good at?\" Once this is done, the person discovers what they are: - their mission - their vocation - their profession - their passion. It is also up to the individual to fill in these four fields. Note that the intersections of 3 circles represent motives of dissatisfaction in life that people may have. In order to find fullness, they must consider the missing circle, giving rise to their Ikigai. "
" How would you like to set up your IKIGAI?"
You must select an option to continue.

" When including all circles, your ikigai should look similar to the one above. If you do not like the color, you can delete and redo it as many times as you like by clicking the delete option in the side menu of the application."
Before selecting the color, you must choose a circle. You should only perform this procedure once for each circle, but all circles must be designed to validate Ikigai.
" When you choose the color and circle, it will appear on the screen similar to this."
" Clicking on the circles icon in the application's activity bar will open a menu with color options to color your circle."
" You can change the color using the bars and you can see a preview of the color before selecting."
